decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | All external materials to be used in the extensions hereby permitted shall match the appearance of those of the existing dwellinghouse.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the extensions hereby permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No part of the roof of the extensions shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.  REASON:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed window panels (on the southwest side of the proposed extension), shown in the proposed side elevation of the proposal approved shall contain only obscure glass, and shall be fixed shut and be permanently retained as such. The approval of the Local Planning Authority shall be obtained, in writing, should any changes be sought.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 5.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
description: Two-storey side extension, single-storey rear extension and two rooflights in front roofslope of house
